page.title: 19A GRETTON SCRIPT-WRITER
page.content: Colin Bostock-Smith is a radio and television script-writer living in Gretton. On a typical day in his working week, he starts by watching some of his programmes on video tape whilst having his breakfast. On the particular day he was interviewed, he was expecting a visit from the director of a new programme shortly to be produced for Television South. Normally Colin works during the morning and part of the afternoon. Then he likes to play a round of golf on Corby's Municipal Golf Course. He starts work on his script-writing again at about 1700hrs. Late in the evening, he likes to go to Gretton's oldest public house, the Hatton Arms, for a drink with his friends. He says he splits his day up like this so that he can concentrate hard for a while and then relax.
